metadata.title: CVE-2018-6046 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in DevTools in Google Chrome prior to64.0.3282.119 allowed a remote attacker to potentially leak usercross-origin data via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
